intro: Chelidonium majus var. pleniflorum, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has broad, lobed leaves that are often covered in a white, waxy coating. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
